description: Checks if any two numbers in the list are closer to each other than the given threshold.
Splits a string of multiple groups of balanced parentheses (separated by spaces) into a list of those groups.
Returns the fractional part of a positive floating-point number (the part after the decimal point).
Given a list of account operations (deposits and withdrawals), returns True if at any point the running balance goes below zero.
Calculates the Mean Absolute Deviation of a list of numbers (average of absolute differences from the mean).
Inserts a given delimiter element between every pair of consecutive elements in the input list.
Analyzes a string of nested parentheses and returns information (e.g., depth or structure).
Returns a list of those strings from the input list that contain the given substring.
Given a list of integers, returns a tuple where the first element is the sum of the numbers and the second is their product.
Processes a list of numbers and returns a list where each element is the maximum of all elements up to that index in the original list.
Constructs the shortest palindrome that starts with the given string (possibly by appending characters at the end).
Performs a binary XOR operation on two binary string inputs and returns the result as a binary string.
Returns the longest string from a list of strings (the first longest if there is a tie), or None if the list is empty.
Computes the greatest common divisor (GCD) of two integers a and b.
Generates a list of all prefixes of the input string, from shortest to longest.
Returns a space-separated string of all numbers from 0 up to n (inclusive).
Counts the number of distinct characters in a string (case-insensitive).
Parses a music notation string of special ASCII symbols and returns a list of integers representing the beat counts of each note.
Counts how many times a given substring appears in a string, including overlapping occurrences.
Takes a space-delimited string of number words ('zero' to 'nine') and returns them sorted numerically as a space-delimited string.
Given a list of floats, finds the two distinct elements that are closest in value and returns them as a (min, max) tuple.
Linearly rescales a list of numbers so that the smallest becomes 0.0 and the largest becomes 1.0.
Filters out non-integers from the input list and returns a list of integers only.
Returns the length of the given string.
Finds the largest divisor of n that is smaller than n (for n > 1).
Returns the prime factorization of an integer as a list of prime factors (in non-decreasing order, including repeats).
Removes all elements that appear more than once in the list and returns the list of unique-occurrence elements in their original order.
Flips the case of each letter in the string (lowercase letters become uppercase and vice versa).
Concatenates a list of strings into one single string.
Returns a list of the strings from the input list that start with the given prefix.
Returns a list containing only the positive numbers from the input list (greater than 0).
Determines if the given integer is a prime number (returns True if prime, False otherwise).
Given the coefficients of a polynomial, finds a root (zero) of the polynomial if one exists (under certain conditions).
Sorts the elements at indices that are multiples of 3 in the list, leaving other positions unchanged.
Returns a sorted list of the unique elements from the input list (removing duplicates).
Finds and returns the maximum element in the list.
Counts the occurrences of the digit '7' in all positive integers less than n that are divisible by 11 or 13.
Sorts the elements at even indices in the list in increasing order, while leaving elements at odd indices in their original order.
Decodes a string that was encoded by cycling each group of three characters by one position (reverses that cyclic shift).
Returns the n-th Fibonacci number that is also prime.
Checks if any three distinct elements in the list sum up to zero (returns True if such a triple exists).
Calculates the number of head-on collisions that occur when n cars go right and n cars go left on a line (result is n^2).
Returns a new list where each integer from the input list is incremented by 1.
Returns True if there exist two distinct elements in the list that sum to zero.
Converts a given integer to a specified base (base < 10) and returns the representation as a string.
Given the lengths of three sides, returns the triangle's area rounded to 2 decimals if those sides form a valid triangle, otherwise -1.
Computes the n-th number in the Fib4 sequence (a four-term Fibonacci-like sequence).
Returns the median of the list of numbers (for an even-length list, returns the average of the two middle values).
Checks if a given string reads the same forwards and backwards (case-sensitive check).
Computes 2^n modulo p and returns the result.
Decodes a string that was encoded by shifting every character 5 positions forward in the alphabet (wraps around for letters).
Removes all vowels ('a', 'e', 'i', 'o', 'u') from the input string (treating 'y' as a vowel only if it appears at the end).
Returns True if every number in the list is less than the threshold t (False if any number is >= t).
Returns the sum of two numbers x and y.
Checks if two strings consist of exactly the same set of characters (regardless of order or frequency).
Returns the n-th Fibonacci number.
Determines if a string of parentheses is correctly balanced (every '(' has a corresponding ')' in the proper order).
Checks whether the list of numbers is monotonic (entirely non-decreasing or entirely non-increasing).
Finds the common elements between two lists and returns them as a sorted list of unique values.
Returns the largest prime factor of the integer n.
Calculates the sum of all integers from 1 to n (inclusive).
Checks if a string of round brackets is balanced (every '(' matches a later ')').
Given the coefficients of a polynomial (constant term, x term, x^2 term, etc.), returns the coefficients of its derivative.
Computes the n-th number in the FibFib sequence (a Fibonacci-like sequence where fibfib(0)=0, fibfib(1)=0, fibfib(2)=1, and thereafter fibfib(n)=fibfib(n-1)+fibfib(n-2)+fibfib(n-3)).
Counts the number of vowels in the given word (treats 'a', 'e', 'i', 'o', 'u' as vowels, and 'y' as a vowel only if it appears at the end of the word).
Performs a circular right shift on the decimal number's digits by the given amount and returns the result as a string (if shift exceeds digit count, the digits are reversed).
Returns the sum of the ASCII values of all uppercase letters in the input string.
Calculates the number of mangoes given a string like "X apples and Y oranges" and a total fruit count n (result = n - X - Y).
Finds the smallest even number in the list and returns [value, index] (choosing the first occurrence if there are ties). Returns [] if no even number is found or the list is empty.
From a list of positive integers, finds the largest integer that appears at least as many times as its value (returns that integer or -1 if none).
Sorts a list in a "strange" order: pick the smallest element, then the largest of the remainder, then the next smallest, then next largest, and so on.
Calculates the area of a triangle given side lengths a, b, c (using Heron's formula) rounded to two decimals, or returns -1 if the sides do not form a valid triangle.
Returns True if the list of numbers q is "balanced" (palindromic) and the sum of its elements is <= w; otherwise returns False.
Determines the minimum number of elements that must be changed in an array to make it a palindrome.
Compares two lists of strings and returns the one with the smaller total number of characters (or the first list if the totals are equal).
Returns True if the given number a (<100) can be expressed as the product of three prime numbers, otherwise False.
Checks if x is a power of n (i.e., x = n^k for some integer k >= 0). Returns True if yes, False otherwise.
Returns True if the integer a is a perfect cube of some integer (including negatives and 0), otherwise False.
Counts how many characters in the hexadecimal string are prime digits (i.e., '2', '3', '5', '7', 'B', 'D').
